revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Netgear |model=WNR3500 |revision=v1 |series=N300 |fcc_date=01/02/2008 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Foxconn |manuf_model=U12H092 |manuf_rev=T00 |availability=now |type=wireless router |fcc_id=PY307300074 |ic_id=4054A-07300074 |pcb_id=U12H092T00 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Marvell |cpu1_model=88F5180NB1;M 88F5-BBR1, QH50561.0, 0743 B1E TW, 88F5180NB1, C500; |cpu1_cspeed=500 |fla1=8 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX29LV640DBTC-90G |ram1=32 |ram1_brand=Samsung |ram1_model=K4H561638J-LCCC |expansion_if_types= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial=yes,, 6-pin header,, internal,, unpopulated,, 3.3V TTL,, (115200,8,N,1),, JP2,, |wi1_chip1_brand=Marvell |wi1_chip1_model=88W8363;88W8363-BEM1, FT96431.1, 0807 A5P, TW; |wi1_chip2_brand=Marvell |wi1_chip2_model=88W8060 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=2 |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand=Marvell |eth_chip2_model=88E1112;88E1112-NNC1, QR47531.3, 0750 C2P, TW; |eth_chip3_brand=Marvell |eth_chip3_model=88E1112;88E1112-NNC1, QR47531.3, 0750 C2P, TW; |sw_brand=Marvell |sw_model=88E6131;88E6131-LAR1, AJJNQ.1, 0746 B2P, TW; |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips=2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;RFMD;RF5125;RF, 5125, H9F8;2; |flags=boot log |stock_boot=U-Boot;1.1.1;Marvell; |stock_os=Linux;2.4.27;-vrs1; |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid=NETGEAR |default_ssid_regex=^NETGEAR$ |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=password |oui=00:1F:33,00:24:B2 |oui_eth=00:1F:33,00:24:B2 }} {{TagLine|RangeMax Wireless-N Gigabit Router}} :{{SupportPage|vendor=NETGEAR|model=WNR3500v1|vs_id=2615}} *[https://openwrt.org/toh/netgear/wnr3500_v1 On the '''OpenWrt''' Wiki] {{TechInfoDepot|Netgear_WNR3500_v1}} Per a dissected US unit.. *"U12H092", "Rev. 2", and "GP" is silkscreened on the board. :All radial capacitors used are '''CapXon''' branded. *The device has 8MB Flash and 32MB RAM. :The specific P/Ns used are in the infobox. :The [http://club.netgear.com.cn/Knowledgebase/Document.aspx?Did=216 '''netgear.com.cn''' device table] also specifies :the device as having 8MB Flash and 32MB RAM. *The 802.11n radio is using two [http://www.rfmd.com/CS/Documents/5125DS.pdf ''RFMD'' RF5125] :2.4-2.5GHz Power Amplifier ICs ===Serial=== ====Pinout==== 
(3.3) (RxD) (...) (...) (TxD) (GND)
1               JP2
====Info derived from==== {{SCollapse|Serial info |
====version====
# version
Release version : Netgear Wireless Router WNR3500
                  U12H09200/V1.0.36/8.0.36NA
           Time : Jun 11 2009 11:21:42
Boot code version : 1.0.3

====cat /proc/version====
# cat /proc/version
Linux version 2.4.27-vrs1 (weal@svn) (gcc version 3.4.4 (release) 
 (CodeSourcery ARM 2005q3-1)) #1 Thu Jun 4 15:04:37 CST 2009

mtdparts=phys_mapped_flash:1m(kernel),2m@1m(rootfs),1m@3m(uboot)ro

mtd0: 00800000 00010000 "Physically mapped flash"
